alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 27 at 2:49AM CST until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Henry IL, Rock Island and Whiteside Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Clinton and Scott Counties. .Expected heavy rainfall early Monday is expected to bring flooding to the Wapsipinicon and Rock Rivers. At this time, the exact amount of rain and runoff is not certain. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences in outlying areas immediately along the river including basements, yards, driveways, and access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CST Monday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
